intro: Bicornella gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon bicornella, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
